intro: Staurogyne lepidagathoides, commonly known as the water clover, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, creeping growth habit. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are often submerged or floating, adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with showy bracts that attract pollinators. Staurogyne lepidagathoides is often used in aquariums due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in water gardens.
